    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        The screen initialization function before it goes up. Before the screen goes up, we update the Combo boxes, date menus, and the report types menu. In addition, we choose what will be displayed to the user and according to the user type.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • askforreportHandler

        public void askforreportHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function is the heart of the report selection department. In this function we will perform the selection of the report that the user requested and we will send the request to the server and we will get the answer back, according to the user's selections from the existing combo boxes. Of course, there is a possibility that a chain store manager will be able to choose 2 reports at any time.
        Parameters:
        event - - Represntes the event when confirm button pressed in report selector screen
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - - All calls to the server can create an exception

      • setStores

        public void setStores(java.util.ArrayList<Store> stores)
        In this function we initialize the store selection menu. A store manager will show only his store, while a chain manager will have all the stores.
        Parameters:
        stores - - in the initialization we ask for the store list from the DB its stored in stores arraylist and this is the input of this function

      • setOrderReports

        public void setOrderReports(java.util.ArrayList<OrderReport> oReports)
        This function updates all the GUI components associated with the Orders report. If necessary, it updates to 2 reports, of course, according to the user's permissions.
        Parameters:
        oReports - - the answer that come back from the server, an OrderReport arraylist that include all information in the selected date range and specific store.

      • setIncomeReports

        public void setIncomeReports(java.util.ArrayList<IncomesReport> iReports)
        This function updates all the GUI components associated with the Incomes report. If necessary, it updates to 2 reports, of course, according to the user's permissions.
        Parameters:
        iReports - - the answer that come back from the server, an IncomesReport arraylist that include all information in the selected date range and specific store.

      • setSatisfactionReports

        public void setSatisfactionReports(java.util.ArrayList<SatisfactionReport> sReports)
        This function updates all the GUI components associated with the Satisfaction report. If necessary, it updates to 2 reports, of course, according to the user's permissions.
        Parameters:
        sReports - - the answer that come back from the server, an IncomesReport arraylist that include all information in the selected date range and specific store.

      • setHistogramOfCustomerComplaintsReports

        public void setHistogramOfCustomerComplaintsReports(java.util.ArrayList<HistogramOfCustomerComplaintsReport> ccReports)
        This function updates all the GUI components associated with the Histograma report. Part of it its the updating of the data into a stacked bar chart. If necessary, it updates to 2 reports, of course, according to the user's permissions.
        Parameters:
        ccReports - - the answer that come back from the server, an IncomesReport arraylist that include all information in the selected date range and specific store.

      • hideReport2

        public void hideReport2(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        This function controls the ToggleReport2 button which determines whether another report will be displayed. This button will be displayed only to a chain store manager.
        Parameters:
        event - - event represents the behavior when you press the ToggleReport2 button

      • resetall

        public void resetall()
        This function clears the screen. In effect, a window will not be created on a window.

      • yearSelected

        public void yearSelected(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        The EventHandler of both the onAction of cbYear1 and cbYear2
        Parameters:
        event - - the ActionEvent of the EventHandler
